timeline.headline: The Story of My Life
timeline.text:
Life? Don't talk to me about life!
Marvin (in "The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy")

date.headline: Birth
date.text: I was born in Vienna.

date.headline: School Years
date.text:
• Kindergarten
  • Primary school
  • Secondary school

Click on the leafs for more information.

date.headline: Primary School
date.text: St. Elisabeth was a catholic school. I was taught by nuns, so I have very good manners.

date.headline: Secondary School
date.text: I visited the "Gymnasium" and attended courses in latin and french.

date.headline: My first computer experience
date.text: Back then my neighbor allowed me to use his Amiga 500 for work and gaming.

date.headline: My first own pc
date.text:
My first own pc had 16 MB RAM and a 20 GB HD.

The operating system wasn't linux by the way. ;)

date.headline: Matura
date.text: I finished the "Gymnasium" with a top grade.

date.headline: My first own car
date.text: 2000 was a very exciting year. I got my first own car - a Volkswagen.

date.headline: Military Service
date.text: I served as a signalman in the "Wiener Garde".

date.headline: St. Pölten University of Applied Sciences
date.text: I studied Communications and Simulation Engineering in St. Pölten, the capital of Lower Austria.

date.headline: Erasmus - KTH Royal Institute of Technology
date.text: I spent the fifth term of my studies in Stockholm at the KTH.

date.headline: Internship
date.text: During my internship I worked on the project "Bedarfshaltestellen" (On demand public transport systems) and wrote my thesis on it.

date.headline: Graduation
date.text: I graduated with good success from St. Pölten University of Applied Sciences and had the honour to give a brief speech at my graduation.

date.headline: First Job
date.text: At PDTS I worked on a prepaid credit card sales platform for MasterCard. I learned a lot about relational databases and worked mostly with PLSQL and Java.

date.headline: Switzerland
date.text: After working in Vienna for two years I migrated to Switzerland.

date.headline: BDH Solutions
date.text: At the BDH I had ownership of the product SEEK!, which was an HR tool for managing employees and remuneration.

date.headline: Wedding
Sympany - Health Insurances
date.text: At Sympany I worked as a Software Architect. In that time, I designed and developed most of the backend and frontend for the Sympany App, modernized the continuous integration environment, helped standardizing the development process and did a lot of persuading the staff of the advantages of a DevOps culture. The second big project I lead to success was SOAng, a microservice system, based on Docker, Kubernetes and Fabric8 v2.

date.headline: Cedric was born
Vivienne was born
Relocating back to Vienna
